edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.barcodes

Class PersistenceInvariantDescriptor<I,G>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.barcodes.PersistenceInvariantDescriptor<I,G>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the persistence invariant type - ie. the interval type
    G - the generator type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.pair.ObjectObjectPair<I,G>>>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnnotatedBarcodeCollection

    public class PersistenceInvariantDescriptor<I,G>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.pair.ObjectObjectPair<I,G>>>>
    This class is designed to store persistence algorithm invariants for each dimension, with additional information about the generators. It is primarily designed to be used in the case where the persistence invariant type (I) is an interval type, and the generator type (G) is the type of cycles.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

      • getIntervalIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<I>>> getIntervalIterator()
        This function returns an iterator for traversing the intervals. Each element returned by the iterator is a pair consisting of the dimension, and the list of intervals at that dimension.
        Returns:
        an iterator for the intervals
